Common name; Desert night lizard.  
*Xantusia vigilis* has a distribution of California, Utah and Arizona, US, and isolated populations in northern Mexico.   
They can be found in arid and semiarid environments, beneath fallen branches, dead clumps, rocks etc but seldom in the open. 
Females averages 80mm while males averages 65mm and females are heavier as well.  
*X. vigilis* is viviparous, and have a brood size of 1-3, which are typically born in August through October.

(Stebbins, 2003)
